Package preferences

Class PreferencesPersistenceWithJSON

  • java.lang.Object
    • preferences.PreferencesPersistenceWithJSON
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPreferencesPersistence
    public class PreferencesPersistenceWithJSON
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPreferencesPersistence
    An instance of this class handles storing application preferences in a persistent configuration file on disk. In its constructor it create a default config file if the file does not exist. It provides methods for serializing an instance of the application preferences model into the config file as well as restoring a serialized prefereces model from said file. It uses JSON for serialization.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PreferencesPersistenceWithJSON()
      This constructor create a default configuration file if no config file exists.

      Load application preferences by deserializing an ApplicationPreferencesModel instance from the configuration file.
      void storeApplicationPreferences​(ApplicationPreferencesModel applicationPreferences)
      Store application preferences by serializing an ApplicationPreferncesModel instance to a json string and writing it to the configuration file.
